trustfund:
BBFAO-BB FAO,TF029648-PHRD-NATIONAL RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJ.,TF091677-GFDRRTRACK II - MOROCCO: RISK
            MANAGEMENT STRATEGY FOR MOROCCO'S AGRICUL

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rainfed Agriculture
            Development Project for Morocco were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was significant; Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            participatory planning process needs to be adapted to its
            purpose: in the case of 'basic needs', short cuts
            can produce a list of priority investments very quickly. In
            the 'once for all' approach of the project, many
            people seeing an investment delivered in 2011 could not make
            the connection with the diagnostic in which they had
            participated in 2005. Making information accessible to all
            is a key element in the participatory process. The criteria
            for choosing amongst competing claims should be set from the
            outset, but then the decisions themselves should be
            entrusted to a transparent and open local governance
            mechanism. The use of consultants might be best limited to
            areas requiring specialist expertise such as: supervision of
            the diagnostic phase; formation of a strategic vision; or
            in-depth technical studies. The experience of the project
            (and its sister irrigation-based project) suggests that, at
            least for basic services (education, health, water supply),
            the value added of the integrated approach compared to the
            sectoral approach is questionable, especially considering
            the difficulties related to coordination between different
            ministries. Government and Bank should maintain continuous
            dialogue and strive to re-engineer operations to test new
            approaches within new strategic contexts.
